body.p: The following Style Rules provide guidelines for using Oxygen-related names and components:

dlentry.dd: Rule: Use the product key when referring to the various forms of "Oxygen", unless it is in a link, name of a file path, legal reference, or a tag that does not allow the insertion of the product key.
Rule: Do not use ellipses when listing interface actions, even if it has them in its name.

Rule: Use "Content Completion Assistant" (inside a wintitle) when referring to the specific name of this feature. You can use "content completion" or "content completion assistance" for a general reference to the subject.

Rule: When specifically referring to one of the modes, use "editing mode" or "mode" instead of "editor" (for example, "Text editing mode" or "Text mode" instead of "Text editor". It is fine to use "editor" when referring to the editor window in general (without reference to the specific mode).
